newsitem.title: BELGIUM: UM to make new exchange offer for Sibeka.
newsitem.headline: UM to make new exchange offer for Sibeka.

text.p: Belgian non-ferrous metals group Union Miniere (UM) will make a new public exchange offer for 2.7 percent of synthetic diamond subsidiary Sibeka still held by the public, brokerage Petercam said on Monday.

UM raised its stake in Sibeka to 77.7 percent from 54.6 percent through a first exchange offer which was closed on June 20, it said. The remaining 19.6 percent are still owned by South African diamond giant De Beers.
Petercam said that the new offer would be made at the same conditions -- 10 UM shares for every three Sibeka shares -- and would run from June 30 to July 11.
